Contributor: David Allen & Sons, printer.; Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee, publisher.;
Description: Text says that according to the Military Service Act of 1916 every unmarried man of military age can choose one of two courses. One is to enlist at once, and the other is to attest at once, which means he will be called up in due course with his group. No pictorial content.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Series: Poster (Great Britain. Parliamentary Recruiting Committee) ; no. 151.
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.
Physical Description: 1 poster : red and tan ; 78 x 51 cm.
Subject: World War, 1914-1918 -- Propaganda.; War posters -- Great Britain.; United States -- Armed forces -- Recruiting, enlistment, etc.;

Title: Military Service Act 1916
